intro: Cassebeera pulchella, commonly known as the purple beauty apple, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various wildlife species. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy texture, while its stems are woody and can grow up to several meters in height. Cassebeera pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
